name: Guest and the City

reviews.text: From the moment we arrived through to us leaving our hosts were fantastic. we were given a warm and friendly welcome. Dan and Mardi were very helpful in helping us to decide where to eat out. They were so right about the restaurant we ate in, might have missed it if they had not mentioned it.

reviews.text: We were in the loft which had a feeling of being separate from the rest of the bed and breakfast.
reviews.title: Really special

reviews.title: Thank you!!

reviews.title: Couldn't ask for more.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I dont very often write reviews for a hotel, expecially when I havent even stayed here!! However i felt I had to write in because I called guest and the city to book a room, unfortunately they had no vacancies but were so so helpful and gave me the numbers of some other guest houses that may have availabiltiy. Thankyou so much xx Laura
reviews.title: thankyou

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dan and Mardi have got it sorted with this modern accommodation. The rooms are top-notch, I got the best sleep in years, better than home even! The breakfasts were first rate and the hosts were so welcoming, like nothing was too much trouble. The location is very central with shops, seafront, pier and buses all very close by but with none of the noise you would normally associate with being near the action. As suggested on their website we said in advance that we wanted parking, they will sort you out with parking permits and my car spent the next 5 days in the very next street which meant one less thing to worry about. If (when?) we choose to stay overnight in Brighton for any length of time The Guest and The City will be our first choice, very well done D & M!
reviews.title: First class care

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After looking at the advertisement on the internet showing the modern outlook of the guest house we knew it would be the one for us.Soon as we arrived we knew we made the right choice.The hospitality of Mardi and Dan was second to none,the breakfast was fantastic ,room was lovely as is the rest of the guest house and the attention to detail was marvelous.Location is excellent and would definately stay there again and would highly recommend to anyone.
reviews.title: "Oustanding"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Such a beautiful and modern place to stay. Dan and Mardi made us feel right at home as soon as we arrived. It was exactly what we needed after we'd been staying in very basic hotels for a while. The location was fantastic as well- you can walk everywhere and there is a great view of the pier from the bottom of the street. Breakfast was so delicious. I will never forget the smiley face on my hot chocolate every morning! We didn't want to leave and can't wait to stay there again.
reviews.title: You have to stay here when you're in Brighton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Decided to dtay here having read the fantastic reviews on here and have to say we were not disappointed. Excellent location, literally a 2 minute walk from the pier and seafront. Hosts were very friendly and helpful, recommending places to go, restaurants to eat at, etc. They even went the extra mile by going and buying a fan for our room as we were there in the hottest week of the year and it got very warm! Breakfast was the best I have ever had at any B&B or hotel; fresh, beautifully cooked and in plentiful supply! Our room (a standard en-suite double) was fairly small but had everything you needed and was beautifully decorated with quality fixtures, fittings and furnishings - as is the rest of the property. All in all, highly recommended.
reviews.title: Quality through and through

reviews.text: Myself and two friends decided on a long weekend in Brighton for fun, and knowing Brighton pretty well, and having stayed in some of the hotels there but not feeling that they were what we were looking for I decided to research B&B's, and came across Guest and the Citys website and read the reviews on Trip Advisor and really loved it. Once I had booked the room (we went for the family room upstairs which sleeps four but for three of us this was perfect) and from the onset I emailed Mardi and Dan to tell them our arrival plans and also asked them for any restaurant and bar recommendations, and they were really helpful.
reviews.title: Loved it!
Friendly with great location, will stay there again
reviews.text: Once we arrived at the B&B we parked up (this was a bit of a pain to find spaces, but we did get there just after the rush hour hometime traffic, so probably better to get there early afternoon to get a parking space nearby) they were really welcoming and showed us to our rooms which were about 4 flights of stairs up so a bit of a trek but the two adjecent rooms between the 3 of us were lovely. The bathoom (actually a wet room, which took a bit of getting used to but was lovely, as were the Pecknsniffs toilettries) lots of nice little touches, like bottled water, fizz wizz popping candy and love hearts, plus the kitchen area outside our room was well stocked with plates and cutlery, should we need them, plus tea, coffee and biscuits, and lovely glasses for our fizz later!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was a great selection which was made each night before we went to bed, and it was brilliantly cooked by Dan, eggs how you like them, bacon, sausages, toast, beans, hash browns, plus fruit, we really didnt go hungry, and it helped with our hangovers the next day!
reviews.title: Friendly clean hotel in quiet location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall we loved our stay at Guest and the City, would absolutely recommend it to family and friends and would go back, thanks Mardi and Dan for being great hosts!
reviews.title: Just fantastic

reviews.text: My wife and I really enjoyed our stay. The owners were very friendly, with useful recommendations for nightlife. Gorgeous breakfast, stylish rooms and walking distance from everything. I'd definitely recommend to a friend and would love to stay again.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a fantastic stay, Both Mardi and Dan are the best hosts ever! Dan called us on our way down to make sure he had a parking space waiting for us. When we arrived Mardi gave us her fantastic knowledge on all the best places to visit and dine.
reviews.title: Simply the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was perfectly located for all activities! and the breakfast that Dan cooks is truly incredable and cooked to perfection.
reviews.title: Well looked after by friendly and attentive hosts

reviews.text: The next time we are in Brighton we will be staying at Guest and the City,
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.text: (David & Sonja)
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in one of the smaller doubles which was great for a couple of nights stay. Dan and Mardi took the time to find out the kind of things we liked doing and made some great recommendations for bars and restaurants which made a big difference - as we were on such a short trip we didn't really have time to explore too much. Very nice veggie breakfast and coffee in the morning cleared our heads for good times out and about in Brighton :D
reviews.title: Book now for a friendly welcome, great night's sleep and scrummy brekkie!

description: Guest and the City is a boutique Guesthouse that reflects all that we love about Brighton. With seven private bedrooms, situated in the heart of Kemptown, minutes from the centre of Brighton, 30 seconds from the beach and opposite the famous Palace Pier, it’s the perfect location to explore Brighton for Business or pleasure. We want our guesthouse to reflect everything we like about staying in Brighton. Guest in the City therefore takes the best bits of a traditional B&B – a relaxed, friendly service, a central location and of course a top-notch breakfast with locally sourced ingredients – and puts them in modern, high-spec surroundings. The result is a boutique feel without luxury prices. To us, that’s what Brighton is all about – finding new things that surprise you and make you smile.
